channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #151 - A slow week
item.description:
Hi,

after the tons of articles we have seen in the previous few weeks, this week was a bit quiet. Nevertheless you'll find a few interesting articles and a couple of videos.

Enjoy!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

item.title: Tadzik (Tadeusz SoÅ›nierz)
item.description: Tadzik is a Perl 6 developer. A couple of weeks ago we mentioned the Space Invaders clone he wrote in Perl 6. It would be great to encourage him to further work on that game, or to build more games in Perl 6. BTW Yours truly interviewed him about a year ago.

item.title: Perl 5.20 uses its own random number generator
Perl 5.20 optimizes return at the end of a subroutine
Sick of being mocked by unit tests
item.description: Ovid has used to much mocking and it hurt. The bottom line: don't overdo it. He also embedded an excellent video, a conversation between Martin Fowler, Kent Beck and David Heinemeier Hansson.

item.title: Migrating Knotes data the hard way
item.description: When upgrading to Ubuntu 14.04 Yanick found out that KDE's Knotes has changed the format it was using to save notes and it could not upgrade the files itself. No problem. Perl with the help of Yanick could solve the problem. Code included.

item.title: When a failure is not a failure
item.description: Now that I see it I know what I have been missing lately. Barefeet articles! A simple issue in Perl that can bite you too if you don't read the article. And if you don't have warnings on.

item.title: Catalyst Development and Stable Releases: Current Summary
Instant REST API For Any Databases
item.description: waack is a mashup of DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader, SQL::Translator, Dancer providing a web a RESTish web interface to any database with any schema.

item.title: Automating Stratopan Releases with Perl's Dist::Zilla
item.description: Mike Friedman introduces his new module Dist::Zilla::Plugin::UploadToStratopan that allows you to automatically upload new private releases to Stratopan, the cloud-based private CPAN.

item.title: Perl distributions, modules, packages explained
item.description: David Farrell explains what kind of file are in a perl distribution.

item.title: Newest French Perl Mongers board member introduces herself
item.description: I wonder what will the French Perl Mongers say if their new board member will blog in English! - Go Perlgerl!

item.title: Reactive Programming in Perl 6
item.description: Bored by the same old programming stuff? How about taking a walk on the reactive programming side, in Perl 6, with Jonathan Worthington?

item.title: Stylesheet Compression
item.description: In this 17 min talk Simon Bertrang talks about CSS::Compressor and how Perl beat Java in speed.

item.title: Refactoring tools for Perl code
How to Code Like Larry Wall
item.description: A 6 min part of a longer interview from 2011.

item.title: Beginning of inlining, some GSoC work materializes, DSON encoder/decoder
StackOverflow Perl report
MetaCPAN weekly report - Pod::Usage
The year of 19100
item.description: This is one of the parts of the Beginner Perl Maven video cours that was made available.

item.title: Perl-related events
item.description: In the following cities: Orlando (FL/USA), Granada (ES), Sofia (BG), Tokyo (JP), FlÃ¶rli Olten (CH), Salzburg (AT)
